task.title: Write upwards from small parts rather than divide a large document down into small parts
task.shortdesc: Writing using DITA allows you to construct your document from smaller parts that you can assemble usiing a map. Although it requires a bit more forethrought, it will make tha document much easier to maintain and allow the smaller parts to be reused in related documents.

section.title: The end results look similar but they are not
section.p: A document written from the bottom up can look similar to a document split into sections and subsections ("clauses" and "subclauses" in standards), but they are quite different regarding their maintainabilty and (less visibly but not less true), sometimes their ability to be understood by their reader.
